TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit X509Attestation extends Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Provisioning.Service.Attestation
Public NotInheritable Class X509Attestation Inherits Attestation
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit X509Attestation extends Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Provisioning.Service.Attestation

Docs.summary: Representation of a single Device Provisioning Service X509 Attestation.
Docs.remarks:
The provisioning service supports Device Identifier Composition Engine, or DICE, as the device attestation mechanism. To use X509, user must provide the certificate. This class provide the means to create a new attestation for a X509 certificate and return it as an abstract interface .
An X509 attestation can contains one of the 3 types of certificate:
Client or Alias certificate: Called on this class as clientCertificates, this certificate can authenticate a single device.
Signing or Root certificate: Called on this class as rootCertificates, this certificate can create multiple Client certificates to authenticate multiple devices.
CA Reference: Called on this class as X509CAReferences, this is a CA reference for a rootCertificate that can creates multiple Client certificates to authenticate multiple devices.
The provisioning service allows user to create and . For all operations over with X509, user must provide a clientCertificates, and for operations over , user must provide a rootCertificates or a X509CAReferences.
For each of this types of certificates, user can provide 2 Certificates, a primary and a secondary. Only the primary is mandatory, the secondary is optional.
The provisioning service will process the provided certificates, but will never return it back. Instead of it, and will return the certificate information for the certificates.
